SubTopics: Describe how relationships among and between organisms in an ecosystem can be competitive, predatory, parasitic, and mutually beneficial and that these interactions are found across multiple ecosystems.
Content: The diagram shows part of a food web from the Chesapeake Bay.
problems/MAG8S/media/1a.jpg
Which of the following best describes the ecological relationships of the organisms in the food web?

SubTopics: Develop and use a model of the Earth-Sun system to explain the cyclical pattern of seasons, which includes Earth's tilt and differential intensity of sunlight on different areas of Earth across the year.
Content: The diagram shows Earth and the direction of incoming sunlight.
problems/MAG8S/media/2a.jpg
At which two locations is it summer?

SubTopics: Develop and use a model to describe how parts of cells contribute to the cellular functions of obtaining food, water, and other nutrients from its environment, disposing of wastes, and providing energy for cellular processes.
Content: A diagram of an animal cell is shown.
problems/MAG8S/media/3a.jpg
Which part of the cell is responsible for releasing energy during cellular respiration?

SubTopics: Develop and use a model of the Earth-Sun-Moon system to explain the causes of lunar phases and eclipses of the Sun and Moon.
Content: Which of the following best shows the appearance and positions of Earth and the Moon during a total lunar eclipse?

SubTopics: Create visual representations of solutions to a design problem. Accurately interpret and apply scale and proportion to visual representations.
Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
A student in a woodworking class made a drawing of a table, as shown.
problems/MAG8S/media/5a.jpg
Determine the table's actual length, in feet. Show your calculations.
The student plans to show the design of the table to the other students in the class. The student is deciding whether to show the drawing above or an orthographic projection.
Describe one advantage of showing an orthographic projection instead of the drawing above.

SubTopics: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after the substances interact to determine if a chemical reaction has occurred.
Content: Select ALL the beakers from Investigation 1 that show evidence of a chemical change.

SubTopics: Use a model to explain that atoms are rearranged during a chemical reaction to form new substances with new properties. Explain that the atoms present in the reactants are all present in the products and thus the total number of atoms is conserved.
Content: When hydrogen peroxide reacts with iron, hydrogen peroxide first breaks apart to form water and oxygen. In the diagrams shown, hydrogen atoms are white and oxygen atoms are gray.
problems/MAG8S/media/7a.jpg
The law of conservation of mass determines the number of water and oxygen molecules produced in the reaction.
Which of the following models shows the correct number of water and oxygen molecules produced in the reaction?

SubTopics: Plan and conduct an experiment involving exothermic and endothermic chemical reactions to measure and describe the release or absorption of thermal energy.
Content: In Investigation 2, an exothermic reaction occurred as energy was released. What is the BEST evidence that an exothermic reaction occurred in the beaker?

C.Choice: There was a change in the color.

D.Choice: There was an increase in temperature.

SubTopics: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after the substances interact to determine if a chemical reaction has occurred.
Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS THREE PARTS.
Rust is produced when iron reacts with oxygen. The table shows some characteristics of a sample of iron and of a sample of rust.
problems/MAG8S/media/9a.jpg
Identify the THREE characteristics from the table above that can be used to support the claim that iron and rust are different substances.
Explain why the characteristics you identified in Part A help support the claim that iron and rust are different substances.
The model shown represents the reaction between iron and oxygen that results in rust.
problems/MAG8S/media/9b.jpg
Based on the model, explain why iron and rust are different substances.

SubTopics: Interpret basic weather data to identify patterns in air mass interactions and the relationship of those patterns to local weather.
Content: The paths of two air masses, X and Y, are shown in the diagram.
problems/MAG8S/media/10a.jpg
Air mass X is a cold air mass. Air mass Y is a warm air mass. When the air masses meet, winter storms may be produced.
Which of the following MOST LIKELY contributes to the formation of these storms?

A.Choice: Cold air mass X moves over warm air mass Y, and evaporation occurs.

B.Choice: Warm air mass Y moves over cold air mass X, and condensation occurs.

C.Choice: Cold air mass X mixes with warm air mass Y, and the overall temperature increases.

D.Choice: Warm air mass Y mixes with cold air mass X, and the overall temperature decreases.

SubTopics: Explain the role of gravity in ocean tides, the orbital motions of planets, their moons, and asteroids in the solar system.
Content: Which of the following describes what primarily causes the ocean tides in Massachusetts?

B.Choice: gravity from the Moon and the Sun

C.Choice: convection from Earth's north and south poles

D.Choice: magnetism from Earth's north and south poles

SubTopics: Show how the components of a structural system work together to serve a structural function. Provide examples of physical structures and relate their design to their intended use.
Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
The diagram shows a building with four parts labeled, W, X, Y, and Z.
problems/MAG8S/media/12a.jpg
Which part of the diagram represents the foundation of the building?
Which of the following describes the foundation?

A.Choice: It is a flat surface that people can walk on, but it does not help to support the building.

B.Choice: It is a part that the entire building is built upon, and it keeps the building from sinking into the ground.

C.Choice: It is a vertical wall that blocks access and visibility, but it provides structural support for the building.

D.Choice: It is a cover that protects the building, and it shields anything inside from sunlight and precipitation.

SubTopics: Use diagrams of a simple wave to explain that (a) a wave has a repeating pattern with a specific amplitude, frequency, and wavelength, and (b) the amplitude of a wave is related to the energy of the wave.
Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS THREE PARTS.

A student is investigating waves with a piece of rope. The student places the rope on the floor and then moves one end of the rope back and forth, as shown. The wave the student makes has a specific amplitude, frequency, and wavelength.
problems/MAG8S/media/13a.jpg
Which of the following diagrams correctly identifies the different parts of the wave?
Describe how the student's hand motion could be changed to make a wave with a greater frequency.
Describe how the student's hand motion could be changed to make a wave that carries more energy in each wavelength. Explain your reasoning.

SubTopics: Explain the function of a communication system and the role of its components, including a source, encoder, transmitter, receiver, decoder, and storage.
Content: A student uses a keyboard on a laptop to type a message into an instant messaging program. The processor in the laptop runs the instant messaging program's commands. The laptop uses Wi-Fi to connect to the internet. Another student reads the message on a phone.
Which of the following correctly categorizes the parts of the communication system?

SubTopics: Analyze and interpret maps showing the distribution of fossils and rocks, continental shapes, and seafloor structures to provide evidence that Earth's plates have moved great distances, collided, and spread apart.
Content: The map shows a ridge on the ocean floor. The dashed lines on either side of the ridge represent different parts of the ocean floor. The parts of the ocean floor are labeled with their ages in millions of years.
problems/MAG8S/media/15a.jpg
Based on the information in the map, which of the following best describes the ridge?

A.Choice: The ridge is a young volcanic mountain range formed by two plates  colliding.

B.Choice: The ridge is a boundary between two plates that are moving away from the ridge.

C.Choice: The ridge is an ancient volcanic mountain range located in the middle of an oceanic plate.

D.Choice: The ridge is a boundary between two plates that are sliding back and forth along the ridge.

SubTopics: Construct an argument supported by evidence that the body systems interact to carry out essential functions of life.
Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
A student is eating an apple.
Which of the following describes how the student's body systems work together to release energy from the apple?

A.Choice: The digestive system breaks down the apple into usable molecules, and the circulatory system delivers the usable molecules to the cells.

B.Choice: The respiratory system breaks down the apple into usable molecules, and the digestive system delivers the usable molecules to the cells.

C.Choice: The circulatory system breaks down the apple into usable molecules, and the excretory system delivers the usable molecules to the cells.

D.Choice: The excretory system breaks down the apple into usable molecules, and the respiratory system delivers the usable molecules to the cells.

Content: Body cells use oxygen to release energy from the molecules that were part of the apple. Which body system brings in oxygen from the environment, and how do body cells use the oxygen to release energy?

A.Choice: The circulatory system brings in oxygen, and body cells use the oxygen for cell division.

B.Choice: The excretory system brings in oxygen, and body cells use the oxygen for cell digestion.

C.Choice: The digestive system brings in oxygen, and body cells use the oxygen for cellular respiration.

D.Choice: The respiratory system brings in oxygen, and body cells use the oxygen for cellular respiration.

SubTopics: Analyze and interpret rock layers and index fossils to determine the relative ages of rock formations that result from processes occurring over long periods of time.
Content: Rock layers W, Y, and Z and fault X are shown. The rock layers and the fault were formed at different times.
problems/MAG8S/media/17a.jpg
Which of the following shows the order of formation from oldest to youngest?

SubTopics: Construct an argument based on evidence for how environmental and genetic factors influence the growth of organisms.
Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
A farmer tested the effect of fertilizer on the growth of 1000 pea plants. The farmer recorded the following observations.
problems/MAG8S/media/18a.jpg
Based on the observations, identify one characteristic of the pea plants that was mainly influenced by genetics. Support your answer with evidence from the information in the table.
Based on the observations, identify one characteristic of the pea plants that was influenced by BOTH genetics and the environment. Support your answer with evidence from the information in the table.

SubTopics: Use graphical displays to illustrate that Earth and its solar system are one of many in the Milky Way galaxy, which is one of billions of galaxies in the universe.
Content: Which of the following best shows the structure of the universe?

SubTopics: Analyze and compare properties of metals, plastics, wood, and ceramics, including flexibility, ductility, hardness, thermal conductivity, electrical conductivity, and melting point.
Content: A manufacturer is considering using four different materials to construct a pan for cooking on a stove. The table shows the thermal conductivity and melting point of each material. A material with a higher thermal conductivity value conducts more thermal energy.
problems/MAG8S/media/20a.jpg
Which materials should be used for the pan?

A.Choice: The manufacturer should use aluminum for the bottom of the pan and iron for the handle.

B.Choice: The manufacturer should use aluminum for the bottom of the pan and copper for the handle.

C.Choice: The manufacturer should use iron for the bottom of the pan and stainless steel for the handle.

D.Choice: The manufacturer should use copper for the bottom of the pan and stainless steel for the handle.

SubTopics: Construct and interpret data and graphs to describe the relationships among kinetic energy, mass, and speed of an object.
Content: A student used a computer simulation to investigate how the kinetic energy of an object changes as the object's mass changes. The object moves at a constant speed during the simulation. The graph shows the kinetic energy of the object with three different masses. The student also ran the simulation with a fourth mass of 8 kg, which is not shown on the graph.
problems/MAG8S/media/21a.jpg
Which graph shows the kinetic energy of the object with the 8 kg mass?

SubTopics: Develop and use a model to show that sexually reproducing organisms have two of each chromosome in their cell nuclei, and hence two variants (alleles) of each gene that can be the same or different from each other, with one random assortment of each chromosome passed down to offspring from both parents.
Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.

A plant species produces two types of seeds, rounded seeds and wrinkled seeds. The allele for rounded seeds (R) is dominant to the allele for wrinkled seeds (r). A plant heterozygous for this trait (Rr) is crossed with a homozygous plant (rr).
Which Punnett square correctly shows this cross?
What is the probability that an offspring will have rounded seeds?

SubTopics: Use the concept of systems engineering to model inputs, processes, outputs, and feedback among components of a transportation, structural, or communication system.
Content: A computer touch screen allows users to enter information. Users have complained that the touch screen is too difficult to operate because the system does not indicate when a choice has been selected.
The complaints are which element of the universal systems model?
